org.parosproxy.paros.core.proxy

Interface OverrideMessageProxyListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ArrangeableProxyListener

    public interface OverrideMessageProxyListener
extends ArrangeableProxyListener
    A listener that will be notified when a new request is ready to be forwarded to the server and when a new response is ready to be forwarded to the client.

    It can override a message by returning a response without forwarding the request to the target server. Or override the response from the server without notifying any other listener.

    Since:
    2.3.0
    See Also:
    ProxyListener

      • Methods inherited from interface org.parosproxy.paros.core.proxy.ArrangeableProxyListener

        getArrangeableListenerOrder

    • Method Detail

      • onHttpRequestSend

        boolean onHttpRequestSend(HttpMessage msg)
        Notifies the listener that a new request was received from the client and is ready to be forwarded to the server.

        The HttpMessage msg can be modified (preferably only when overriding the request). If the return value is true the message will not be forwarded to the server, no more listeners will be notified and the response set to the msg will be returned to the client. If the value is false the message may be forward and the following listeners will be notified.

        Note: In the presence of more than one listener there are no guarantees that:

        • the message will really be forwarded to the server, even if the return value is false, as the following ProxyListeners may drop it.

        Parameters:
        msg - the HttpMessage that may be overridden and not forwarded to the server
        Returns:
        true if the message should be overridden and not forward to the server, false otherwise
        See Also:
        ProxyListener.onHttpRequestSend(HttpMessage)

      • onHttpResponseReceived

        boolean onHttpResponseReceived(HttpMessage msg)
        Notifies the listener that a new response was received from the server and is ready to be forwarded to the client.

        The HttpMessage msg can be modified (preferably only when overriding the response). If the return value is true the message will be forwarded to the client and no more listeners will be notified. If the value is false the message may be forwarded and the following listeners will be notified.

        Note: In the presence of more than one listener there are no guarantees that:

        • the message will really be forwarded to the client, even if the return value is false, as the following ProxyListeners may drop it.

        Parameters:
        msg - the HttpMessage that may be forwarded to the client
        Returns:
        true if the message should be forwarded to the client, false otherwise
        See Also:
        ProxyListener.onHttpResponseReceive(HttpMessage)
